Prepare the Patties:

Take the ground beef and shape it into burger patties. You can typically make them about 1/3 to ½ pound (150–225 grams) each, depending on your preference.

Season both sides of each patty with salt and pepper. You can also add other seasonings or spices if you like.Heat the Grill or Pan:


Preheat your grill or a skillet over medium–high heat. Make sure it's hot before you start cooking.

Cook the Patties:


Place the burger patties on the grill or in the skillet.

For medium–rare burgers, cook for about 3–4 minutes per side.

For medium burgers, cook for about 4–5 minutes per side.

For well-done burgers, cook for about 6-7 minutes per side.

Add cheese slices on top of the patties during the last minute of cooking to melt.

Toast the Buns:

While the patties are cooking, split the hamburger buns in half.

Place the bun halves on the grill or in a toaster for a minute or so to lightly toast them. This adds a nice crunch to the burger.

Assemble the Burger:

Begin assembling your burger on the bottom half of the toasted bun.

Start with a lettuce leaf, followed by a slice of tomato and onion. Add pickles if desired.

Place the cooked patty with melted cheese on top of the veggies.

Add Condiments:

Squirt ketchup, mustard, and mayonnaise (if using) on the patty.

Top it Off:

Place the top half of the bun on the condiments to complete the burger.

Serve and Enjoy:

Your classic hamburger is now ready to be enjoyed! Serve it with your favorite sides like French fries, coleslaw, or a salad.
Feel free to customize your burger with additional toppings and condiments to suit your taste. Enjoy your delicious homemade hamburger!

Ground beef
Salt and pepper
Hamburger buns
Lettuce leaves
Tomato slices
Onion slices
Pickles (optional)
Cheese slices
Ketchup
Mustard
Mayonnaise (optional)
